message_1:
Find the unknotting number of the following knot:

Image: https://i.imgur.com/VAEnsxl.png

Note: The unknotting number of a knot is the minimum number of times one must pass a segment under or over another in order to transform the knot into an unknotted loop.
message_2: The given knot is a trefoil knot, which is the simplest nontrivial knot. The unknotting number of a trefoil knot is 1. This means that you need to pass a segment under or over another segment at least once to transform the knot into an unknotted loop.
